lexUnit.name: thunder.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making a loud rumbling or crashing sound

sentence.text: The tow rope sprang taut , plucking the dinghy clear as the swell broke , thundering forward on to the waiting coral .
A second Warlord thundered forward , and halted .
Exhilaration filled Roget as he thundered forward .
He kicked the grey into a gallop , and it thundered across the grass , throwing up torn lichen and humus .
Great herds of horses thunder across the sweeping plains of Ellyrion .
When the beachmaster is angered by a serious challenge , he thunders across the sand , humping and heaving his huge body with surprising speed and taking no notice whatever of what lies in his way .
` Not so fast , " she cried as they thundered along Rodney Street .
As the coach thundered into Glasgow , the post-horn would be sounded and a blunderbuss fired into the air .
The latest crop of large men with large guns thundered into the studio and formed themselves into a chaotic firing squad .
They thunder into the wasteground opposite , then stop and wait , itching for a fight with their pursuers .
Barney , who had been deep in thought , spoke as the car thundered past the Berkeley Hunt kennels .

You could feel the dismay amongst the Leeds players and their fans as it thundered past John Lukic and into the back of the net , leaving them searching for three goals to progress in the competition .
Two fingers I had waved at that driver as he thundered past me , cursing me through the open cab window and fighting the wheel , and those two fingers I now regretted having on my hand .
Train spotting had hardly become an attraction for the boys of the day when the first Easter excursion thundered through Balcombe Tunnel en route to Brighton .
I laughed and set spurs to my horse and thundered through the convent gates as fast as a deer .
The juggernaut thundered through the countryside , returning to Salisbury Plain .
Two hefty figures in combat suits thundered through the doors , spraying the saloon with fire .
More adrenalin poured into her system , raising her pulse , sending the blood thundering through her veins as her face paled .
His description of how he watched helplessly as one of the deadly missiles thundered towards him makes chilling reading .
As they disappeared towards the lift a stampede of policemen emerged from the library and thundered towards the stairs .
We camped about five kilometres north of Lddejkkstugan on the open moors by a stream that thundered towards the distant watershed from Virihaure .
He was still in the middle of the road when the horses thundered up to the inn .
The tramcar thundered past .
As the pursuit thundered past , Ramsay saw , under the great royal standard , a richly armoured knight who wore a golden circlet round his helmet -- Balliol himself .
As the mail train thundered past and disappeared into the distance he heard the familiar sound of footsteps .
Eve , picking up on some of Ari 's melancholy without understanding the cause , hugged her as they thundered along the straight , smooth road that led to the city .
To his left , increasingly distant , the lorries thundered on towards Rio .
The jeep left the road and was fishtailing violently through a stretch of gravel as the fire truck thundered by .
